channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15990] The priority value of subsequent coprocessors in the Coprocessor.Priority.SYSTEM list are not incremented by one
item.description:
CoprocessorHost.java

// The Coprocessor.PRIORITY_SYSTEM should be replaced by priority

        this.coprocessors.add(loadInstance(implClass, Coprocessor.PRIORITY_SYSTEM, conf));

        LOG.info("System coprocessor " + className + " was loaded " +

            "successfully with priority (" + priority++ + ").");
item.summary: The priority value of subsequent coprocessors in the Coprocessor.Priority.SYSTEM list are not incremented by one

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Interesting.


163	            "successfully with priority (" + priority + ").");

The above log should be modified - priority has been incremented in the statement above. So the value logged above is no longer the one loaded.
Nice find. Yeah, Ted is right, the logged priority will be off by one. How about moving the increment after the log line?

-1 overall

+      public CoprocessorEnvironment createEnvironment(Class<?> implClass,

Is it possible to refactor the CoprocessorEnvironment from TestCoprocessorHost#testDoubleLoading() - only getPriority() is different between that and yours ?
